documentType: Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Report
summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services report evaluating Jeffrey Epstein's competency to proceed with a disciplinary process following an incident report for tattooing or self-mutilation (code 228). The report, dated July 30, 2019, concludes that Epstein is competent to proceed, based on clinical interviews and suicide risk assessments from July 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being evaluated for competency to proceed with a disciplinary process after being charged with code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation) following an incident on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.role: Psychologist / Author of Suicide Risk Assessment
persons.context: A psychologist (PsyD) who authored a Suicide Risk Assessment on July 9, 2019, and is the provider/author of this competency evaluation report.

connections.description: Dr. conducted psychological evaluations and suicide risk assessments on inmate Epstein and authored the competency report.

events.title: Epstein Charged with Tattooing/Self-Mutilation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with Bureau of Prisons code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation), assigned incident report number 3282555, leading to a referral for competency evaluation.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment by Dr.
events.description: Dr. conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on Epstein where he denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior.

events.title: Follow-up Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: A follow-up Suicide Risk Assessment noted it was unclear if Epstein placed a string around his own neck or if someone else did, and that Epstein did not remember how he obtained marks on his neck.

events.title: Competency Evaluation Completed
events.description: Dr. completed the Psychology Services Institution Disciplinary Process Report, finding Epstein competent to proceed with the disciplinary process.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was charged with BOP code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation) under incident report 3282555.
A psychological evaluation on July 30, 2019, concluded Epstein was competent to proceed with the disciplinary process.
A Suicide Risk Assessment on July 23, 2019, noted it was unclear if Epstein placed a string around his own neck or if someone else did, and Epstein had no memory of how he got the marks.
Epstein denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior in assessments on July 9, 2019.
The report was generated by a PsyD at the Bureau of Prisons' NYM facility (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York).
